provenance.textSnippet:
5.2.1 Phase 1 Inclusion Criteria
A subject will be eligible for study participation if he/she meets the following criteria:
1. The subject must be ≥ 18 years of age.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a single, atomic condition that establishes a minimum age requirement for the subject. It can be represented as a single atomic node with a numeric constraint.

expression.strategy: This is a standard requirement to ensure subjects are legal adults for consent and regulatory purposes.

atomicCriteria.strategy: This is a standard requirement to ensure subjects are legal adults for consent and regulatory purposes.

Hepatic function and enzymes: AST and ALT ≤ 3.0 × the upper normal limit (ULN) of institution's normal range; Bilirubin ≤ 1.5 × ULN. Subjects with Gilbert's Syndrome may have a Bilirubin > 1.5 × ULN;
Coagulation: aPTT, PT, not to exceed 1.2 × ULN.

criteria.originalText:
Female subjects must be surgically sterile, postmenopausal (for at least 1 year), or have negative results for a pregnancy test performed as follows:

● At Screening on a serum sample obtained within 14 days prior to initial study drug administration, and
● Prior to dosing on a urine sample obtained on Cycle 1 Day 1 or Lead-in Day 1 (lead-in period) if it has been > 7 days since obtaining the serum pregnancy test results.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion applies to female subjects and presents three alternative ways to be eligible, forming a top-level OR structure. The third option, involving pregnancy tests, is a complex AND condition combining a mandatory negative serum test with a conditional negative urine test, which is modeled using an IMPLICATION operator.

criteria.originalText: The subject has a history or is clinically suspicious for cancer-related Central Nervous System (CNS) disease.

provenance.textSnippet:
5.2.2 Phase 1 Exclusion Criteria
A subject will not be eligible for study participation if he/she meets any of the following 
criteria:
1. The subject has a history or is clinically suspicious for cancer-related Central 
Nervous System (CNS) disease.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is a simple disjunction (OR) of two conditions. A subject is included if they have either a documented history of cancer-related CNS disease or if a clinician finds them suspicious for it. This is represented by an OR operator with two atomic operands.

operands.atomicText: History of cancer-related Central Nervous System (CNS) disease
operands.strategy: Checks for a formal diagnosis of CNS disease related to cancer, such as brain metastases or primary CNS tumors, in the patient's medical history.

operands.atomicText: Clinically suspicious for cancer-related Central Nervous System (CNS) disease
operands.strategy: Captures clinical judgment where CNS disease is suspected based on symptoms or signs, even without a confirmed diagnosis. This typically requires manual chart review.

atomicCriteria.atomicText: History of cancer-related Central Nervous System (CNS) disease
atomicCriteria.strategy: Checks for a formal diagnosis of CNS disease related to cancer, such as brain metastases or primary CNS tumors, in the patient's medical history.

atomicCriteria.atomicText: Clinically suspicious for cancer-related Central Nervous System (CNS) disease
atomicCriteria.strategy: Captures clinical judgment where CNS disease is suspected based on symptoms or signs, even without a confirmed diagnosis. This typically requires manual chart review.

subCriteria.text: Bone marrow: Absolute Neutrophil count (ANC) ≥ 1000/μL; Platelets ≥ 75,000/mm3 (entry platelet count must be independent of transfusion within 14 days of Screening); Hemoglobin ≥ 9.0 g/dL;
Renal function: Serum creatinine ≤ 2.0 mg/dL or calculated creatinine clearance ≥ 50 mL/min;
Hepatic function and enzymes: AST and ALT ≤ 3.0 × the upper normal limit (ULN) of institution's normal range; Bilirubin ≤ 1.5 × ULN. Subjects with Gilbert's Syndrome may have a Bilirubin > 1.5 × ULN;
Coagulation: aPTT, PT must not exceed 1.2 × ULN.

(entry platelet count must be independent of 
transfusion within 14 days of Screening); Hemoglobin ≥ 9.0 g/dL;

criteria.originalText:
Female subjects must be surgically sterile, postmenopausal (for at least 1 year), or have negative results for a pregnancy test performed as follows:

● At Screening on a serum sample obtained within 14 days prior to initial study drug administration, and
● Prior to dosing on a urine sample obtained on Lead-in Day 1 if it has been > 7 days since obtaining the serum pregnancy test results.

subCriteria.text: At Screening on a serum sample obtained within 14 days prior to initial study drug administration, and
Prior to dosing on a urine sample obtained on Lead-in Day 1 if it has been > 7 days since obtaining the serum pregnancy test results.

provenance.textSnippet:
● Coagulation: aPTT, PT must not exceed 1.2  ULN.
7. Female subjects must be surgically sterile, postmenopausal (for at least 1 year), or 
have negative results for a pregnancy test performed as follows:
● At Screening on a serum sample obtained within 14 days prior to initial study
drug administration, and
● Prior to dosing on a urine sample obtained on Lead-in Day 1 if it has been 
> 7 days since obtaining the serum pregnancy test results.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion applies to female subjects and presents three main eligibility pathways structured as an OR statement: surgically sterile, postmenopausal, or meeting pregnancy test requirements. The pregnancy test path is a composite AND condition, featuring a mandatory negative serum test and a conditional negative urine test, which is modeled using an IMPLICATION operator to capture the 'if...then' logic.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: This criterion represents a single, fundamental procedural requirement for study entry. It is decomposed into one core atomic event—providing valid informed consent—which is then constrained by a temporal node to ensure the event occurs before any study activities commence.

temporalConstraint.anchor: initiation of any screening or study-specific procedures

operand.atomicText: Subject has voluntarily signed and dated an informed consent, approved by an Independent Ethics Committee (IEC)/Institutional Review Board (IRB)
operand.strategy: This is a core ethical and procedural requirement. Verification is done by manually reviewing the signed and dated Informed Consent Form (ICF) in the subject's source documents to confirm the signature date precedes the date of any study-related procedure. Subjects entering the Extension Study must also have stable lab values per applicable laboratory reference ranges.

provenance.textSnippet:
5.2.5 Extension Study Inclusion Criteria
Subjects who enter the Extension Study must continue to meet all Inclusion and Exclusion 
criteria (excluding laboratory parameters) from Phase 1 or in Phase 2a as listed above. 
Subjects entering the Extension Study must also have stable lab values per applicable 
laboratory reference ranges.

criteria.decompositionStrategy: The criterion is decomposed using a top-level AND operator to connect two main requirements. The first requirement is complex: subjects must meet criteria from 'Phase 1 OR Phase 2a', where each phase's criteria has an exception for 'laboratory parameters', which is handled by an EXCEPT operator. The second requirement is a simple condition for stable lab values.

Subjects must meet the following hematology and coagulation lab criteria:

○ Platelet counts must be ≥ 25,000/mm3 (untransfused). Platelet counts ≤ 50,000/mm3 must be stable and monitored at an increased frequency at the discretion of the investigator.
○ Absolute Neutrophil count (ANC) ≥ 500/μL. ANC ≥ 500/μL and < 1,000/μL should be monitored at an increased frequency at the discretion of the investigator.
○ Hemoglobin of ≥ 8.0 g/dL.
○ aPTT, PT is not to exceed 1.2 × ULN.

criteria.originalText:
Subjects must meet the following chemistry criteria:

○ Subjects' chemistry values must not exceed Grade 2. Grade 2 chemistry labs should be monitored at an increased frequency at the discretion of the investigator.
○ Serum creatinine ≤ 3.0 × the upper normal limit (ULN) of institution's normal range.
○ AST and ALT ≤ 5.0 × the upper normal limit (ULN) of institution's normal range.
○ Bilirubin ≤ 3.0 × ULN. Subjects with Gilbert's Syndrome may be allowed to have a Bilirubin > 3.0 × ULN based on a joint decision between the investigator and AbbVie medical monitor.
